document.docAuthor: Zhong, Yang, Jäger, Peter, Chen, Jian & Liu, Jie
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the Sinopoda okinawana - group (Araneae: Sparassidae) in China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the Sinopoda okinawana - group (Araneae: Sparassidae) in China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sinopoda fasciculata Jäger et al ., 2002: 25
, figS 10–12 (deScription of male).

Material examined. CHINA :
Guizhou Province
:
1 male , Liupanshui City, Xianshuipo Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery, 26°36'N , 104°50'E ,
1966 m
,
11 April 2016
, Yang Zhong , Yang Zhu & He Zhang leg. ( CBEE )
;
1 male , 2 females , Zunyi City , Honghuagang Town , Fenghuangshan Forest Park, 27°41'N , 106°55'E ,
939 m
,
13 April 2016
, Yang Zhong , Yang Zhu & He Zhang leg. ( CBEE )
;
1 male , 3 females , Zunyi City , Daozhen County , Yangxi Town , Dashahe National Nature Reserve , 29°07'N , 107°34'E ,
1385 m
,
18 April 2016
, Yang Zhong , Yang Zhu & He Zhang leg. ( CBEE )
;
5 males , 2 females , Tongren City , Jiangkou County , Fangjingshan National Nature Reserve , 27°54'N , 108°45'E ,
693 m
,
23 April 2016
, Yang Zhong , Yang Zhu & He Zhang leg. ( CBEE )
;
6 males , 4 females , Guiyang City, Qingrengu Scenic Area, 26°36.7'N , 106°48.2'E ,
1011 m

26 April 2016

Hunan Province
:
1 male , 4 females , Huaihua City , Yuanling County , Jiemuxi National Nature Reserve , 28°52'N , 110°26'E ,
431 m
,
22 August 2015
, Jian Chen , Jianyong Li & Yang Zhong leg. ( CBEE )
;
1 male , 5 females , Yiyang City , Anhua County , Liubuxi National Nature Reserve , 28°21'N , 110°50'E ,
417 m
,
2 August 2015
, Jian Chen , Jianyong Li & Yang Zhong leg. ( CBEE )
;
1 female , Xiangxi Tujia and Miao Autonomous Prefecture , Yongshun County , Xiaoxi National Nature Reserve , 28°49'N , 110°15'E ,
586 m
,
24 August 2015
, Jian Chen , Jianyong Li & Yang Zhong leg. ( CBEE ).

Diagnosis. Females of this species are similar to those of
Sinopoda derivata Jäger & Ono, 2002
in having a narrow lobal septum and long anterior bands, but are distinguished from the latter by the following characters: 1. epigynal bulges present, long in
S. fasciculata
, but absent in
S. derivata
; 2. glandular appendages as wide as posterior part of spermathecae in
S. fasciculata
, but slightly narrower in
S. derivata
; 3. internal duct system diverging medially in
S. fasciculata
( Figs 2A–B , 3D–E ), but running parallel along the median line in
S. derivata
. For males see Jäger et al . (2002).
Description. Male: See Jäger et al . (2002).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1A–E.
Sinopoda cochlearia Zhang, Zhang & Zhang, 2015
from JinggangShan Revolutionary MartyrS Cemetery. A–C Left male palp (A prolateral, B ventral, C retrolateral); D Epigyne, ventral; E Vulva, dorSal. Scale barS: 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 2A–B.
Sinopoda fasciculata Jäger, Gao & Fei, 2002
from FangjingShan National Nature ReServe. A Epigyne, ventral; B Vulva, dorSal. AB—anterior bandS, EB—epigynal bulgeS, FD—fertilization duct, GA—glandular appendage, LF—lateral furroWS, LL—lateral lobeS, LS—lobal Septum, MS—membranouS Sac, PP—poSterior part of Spermathecae, SS—Slit SenSillum. Scale barS: 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 3A–E.
Sinopoda fasciculata Jäger, Gao & Fei, 2002
from FangjingShan National Nature ReServe. A–C Left male palp (A prolateral, B ventral, C retrolateral); D Epigyne, ventral; E Vulva, dorSal. Scale barS: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female: Measurements: PL 8.9, PW 7.8; AW 4.4; OL 9.1, OW 5.1. Eyes: AME 0.31, ALE 0.51, PME 0.31, PLE 0.53, AME–AME 0.41, AME–ALE 0.21, PME–PME 0.54, PME–PLE 0.76, AME–PME 0.61, ALE–PLE 0.59, CH AME 0.36, CH ALE 0.42. Spination: Palp: 131, 101, 2021, 1014; Fe: I–III 323, IV 331; Pa: I–III 101, IV 001; Ti: I–III 2026 , IV 2126 ; Mt: I–II 1014 , III 2026 , IV 3036. Measurements of palp and legs: Palp 11.2 (3.5, 1.4, 2.6, –, 3.7); I 31.4 (9.3, 4.2, 8.1, 7.5, 2.3); II 33.5 (9.7, 4.5, 9.3, 7.9, 2.1); III 26.7 (8.0, 3.6, 6.7, 6.3, 2.1); IV 27.7 (9.0, 3.4, 8.1, 5.1, 2.1). Leg formula: II-I-IV-III. Cheliceral furrow with 3 anterior and 4 posterior teeth, and with ca. 26 denticles.

Copulatory organ as in diagnosis. Epigynal field wider than long, with one slit sensillum on each side close to epigynal field. Lateral lobes fused, posteriorly with two humps, and with median incision. Fertilization ducts arising posterio-laterally. Membranous sac between fertilization ducts almost rectangular ( Figs 2A–B , 3D–E ).
Distribution. China ( Guizhou ; Hunan , new province record) ( Fig. 14 ).
